column1: Carol hasn't won a game of bingo in ages; she must be due for a win soon.
Bob has been late to work all week; he's bound to be on time tomorrow.
My horse has lost three races in a row; it's definitely going to win the next one.
Sarah has been single for three years
column2: she's bound to find someone soon.

column1: The stock market has been declining for three days straight; we're definitely due for a rebound tomorrow.
I failed my driving test four times already
column2: the next one I should pass for sure. It's just matter of statistics.

column1: After three days of losing money at the casino
column2: John felt he was due for a big win.

column1: You've been dating losers for too long
column2: you're bound to meet your prince charming now.

column1: Mary has been trying to have a baby for two years. She absolutely will get pregnant this month.
I've been getting all my predictions wrong on this quiz show. The next one has to be right.
Tom has missed the target five times in a row in darts. He is likely to hit it the next time.
This is the fifth weekend in a row that it's rained
column2: so it's almost a certainty that next weekend will be sunny.

column1: Jimmy has been in the bottom of his class for three years straight. This year he's bound to be in the top.
I have failed to get a government job in my last six attempts. I'm bound to get it this time.
Every time I've gone fishing
column2: I've caught nothing
column3: surely next time I will catch something.

column1: Jack has been taking shots all night but he hasn't been drunk yet. He should be getting drunk any minute now.
I have been unsuccessful at making my online business work. I believe this time it has to work.
I've applied to Harvard five times and got rejected each time. I'm certain to get admitted next time.
I've been working out regularly for a week but haven't lost any weight. Surely
column2: I'll lose weight in the next couple of days.

column1: The national team has been losing in the world cup playoffs for the last three times. This time they should definitely win.
He's been single for four years now
column2: he's due for a relationship.

column1: Janet has been outbidding me on every item tonight
column2: I'm sure to win the next bid.

column1: Every guess I've made while watching this mystery film was wrong. I'm due to make an accurate prediction soon.
I've reached the final round of this game show thrice and lost
column2: surely I must win this time.

column1: Gerald has been the employee of the month for the past four months
column2: it has to be my turn this month.

column1: This is the seventh time I'm trying to cook this recipe and failing
column2: surely eighth time's the charm.

column1: Liam has been failing at the auditions
column2: he's due to get a role.

column1: Our town hasn't had a festival in five years. It is high time one should happen.
I've been playing this lottery for three years. I'm sure to hit the jackpot in the coming draw.
None of the last ten job interviews were successful
column2: I'm definitely going to succeed in the next one.

column1: The basketball team hasn't won a single match this season
column2: they're sure to win the next.

column1: I've been single for the last couple of years – I must meet my soulmate soon.
I invested in five startup ventures
column2: but all of them failed. I'm positive the next one will succeed.

column1: My dog has failed the obedience training the last four times. He will pass it for sure this time.
Penny stocks have been plummeting for five days straight
column2: tomorrow it should finally go up.

column1: The last five times I've bet on football games
column2: I lost. This time
column3: I'm sure I'll win.

column1: She's been getting the lowest scores on every test this year. She's bound to get a high score soon.
I've played this slot machine all evening without a single big win. It's bound to pay out soon.
It hasn't rained in the city for several weeks
column2: it's time for heavy downpour.

column1: My last three relationships were unsuccessful; the next one will surely last.
Every experiment I've tried for my science project has failed. The next one has to work.
He hasn't scored a goal in five games
column2: he's due to score one now.

column1: I've been unlucky in love for so long
column2: I must be due for some luck now.

column1: It's been cold for a week straight
column2: it has to warm up tomorrow.

column1: I've tried to quit smoking multiple times but failed. This time
column2: I'm sure I'll succeed.

column1: You've had such bad luck with roommates; your next one has to be better.
I've never won a single game of poker against John. I must be due for a win.
None of my five children excelled in academics. My sixth child should definitely turn out to be a scholar.
She hasn't fallen sick in years. I'm sure she can't avoid it much longer.
I've been trying to sell my house for six months. I'm sure to get a buyer any day now.
He's been playing the lottery for years without winning. He's got to win soon.
